The claim was flagged as part of Faceboo: s efforts to combat false news and misinformation on its News Feed, indicating that it may not be reliable.
The website publishing the article: ehealthmagz.com, has an unclear identity, as its browser tab says "Health Magazine" but its "about us" section describes it as "Newspaper."
The email address provided on the websit: suggesting that the website may not be trustworthy or credible.
The National Cancer Institute: mentioned in the claim, clarified that the webpage cited in the article is a summary maintained and updated by an editorially independent board of experts, and it does not represent a policy statement from the institute or the National Institutes of Health.
